  "description": "At White Soul Group, we deliver integrated logistics solutions and premium vehicle sales services. Our commitment to innovation, integrity, and customer-centricity sets us apart as a trusted partner in the logistics and automotive sectors.

Job Position: Inventory Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Calabar, Cross River&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Inventory Officer is responsible for managing, monitoring, and maintaining accurate records of all inventory items within the organization.
	The role ensures timely availability of stock, minimizes losses, and maintains proper documentation for operational efficiency.
	The Inventory Officer coordinates with other departments to support smooth business operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Receive, inspect, and record goods delivered to the store.
	Issue items to departments or personnel based on approved requisitions.
	Maintain accurate inventory records and update databases regularly.
	Conduct regular stock counts and reconcile discrepancies.
	Ensure proper storage, labeling, and security of inventory items.
	Monitor stock levels and notify management of shortages or surpluses.
	Prepare and submit inventory reports to management (daily, weekly, monthly).
	Enforce compliance with company policies and standard operating procedures (SOPs).
	Coordinate with procurement, operations, and other departments regarding stock needs.
	Track and maintain company assets, ensuring proper usage and timely replacement.


Education &amp; Qualifications


	Minimum: Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, Logistics, or related field.
	Professional certification in inventory management is an added advantage.


Experience:


	At least 2-3 years of relevant experience in inventory, warehouse, or stock management.
	Experience with computerized inventory systems is preferred.


Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strong organizational and record-keeping skills.
	Attention to detail and accuracy in reporting.
	Basic knowledge of inventory management systems/software.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work independently and in a team.
	Problem-solving skills to handle discrepancies or stock issues.
	Time management and multitasking abilities.


Other Requirements:


	High level of integrity and honesty due to handling of company assets.
	Ability to maintain confidentiality of sensitive information.
	Physically able to inspect and manage inventory items when required.
	Flexible to work during inventory audits or emergency stock counts.


Remuneration


	Salary range: N80,000 - N100,000 / month.
	Benefits: Health insurance, leave entitlement, staff welfare, and other company benefits as applicable.


Method of Application&nbsp;

title: Job Openings at Stella Maris School
content:
Stella Maris School is full of happy and highly motivated children. We are committed to providing a warm, welcoming and nurturing atmosphere with a strong educational ethos and moral values.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Laboratory Attendant

Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Laboratory Attendant is responsible for supporting the effective delivery of practical science lessons by preparing laboratory materials, maintaining laboratory equipment, and ensuring a safe, clean, and well-organized laboratory environment.
	The role supports teachers and students during practical sessions and ensures compliance with safety standards.


Key Responsibilities
Laboratory Preparation & Support:


	Prepare laboratory equipment, chemicals, specimens, and materials for practical science lessons (Biology, Chemistry, Physics).
	Assist science teachers during laboratory practical sessions when required.
	Ensure all materials are properly labeled and arranged before and after experiments.
	Set up and dismantle laboratory apparatus for experiments and demonstrations.


Equipment & Inventory Management:


	Clean, store, and maintain laboratory equipment after use.
	Monitor stock levels of chemicals, consumables, and equipment.
	Keep accurate records of laboratory inventory and report shortages or damages promptly.
	Assist in receiving, checking, and safely storing laboratory supplies.


Safety & Compliance:


	Ensure laboratory safety rules are followed by students at all times.
	Maintain a clean, safe, and hazard-free laboratory environment.
	Properly handle, store, and dispose of chemicals and waste according to safety guidelines.
	Report accidents, spillages, or safety concerns immediately to the appropriate authority.
	Ensure availability and proper use of safety equipment (fire extinguishers, first aid kits, eye wash stations, PPE).


Maintenance & Housekeeping:


	Clean laboratory benches, sinks, floors, and storage areas regularly.
	Ensure laboratory utilities (water, gas, electricity) are switched off after use.
	Identify and report faulty equipment or maintenance issues.


Administrative Duties:


	Maintain laboratory registers, usage logs, and safety records.
	Support annual laboratory audits and inspections.
	Assist with laboratory-related documentation when required.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Previous experience in a school laboratory or similar environment is an advantage.
	Basic knowledge of laboratory equipment and safety procedures.
	Ability to follow instructions accurately and work with minimal supervision.
	Good organizational and time-management skills.
	Physically fit and able to handle laboratory equipment safely.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr.assistantsms@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

2.) Government Teacher

Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Subject teachers play a crucial role in the educational process by specializing in a specific academic subject and guiding students through a comprehensive understanding of that discipline.
	They are responsible for planning, executing, and assessing lessons, fostering a positive learning environment, and contributing to the overall academic development of students.


Responsibilities
Curriculum Planning and Development:


	Develop detailed and well-structured lesson plans aligned with the curriculum and educational standards.
	Create engaging and innovative teaching materials, incorporating various instructional strategies to meet diverse learning styles.


Classroom Instruction:


	Deliver lessons that inspire curiosity and critical thinking, making the subject matter accessible and relevant to students.
	Utilize effective teaching methodologies, technology, and resources to enhance the learning experience.


Assessment and Evaluation:


	Prepare and submit question banks on the scheduled date.
	Design and administer assessments to measure students' understanding of the subject.
	Provide constructive feedback to students on their academic performance, identifying areas of improvement and recognizing achievements.


Student Engagement and Support:


	Foster a positive and inclusive learning environment that encourages active participation and collaboration.
	Provide additional support to students who require assistance, addressing individual learning needs.


Collaboration and Professional Development:


	Collaborate with colleagues to integrate cross-disciplinary approaches and contribute to the overall school curriculum.
	Engage in ongoing professional development activities to stay informed about educational trends, advancements, and best practices within the subject area.


Communication:


	
	Maintain open and effective communication with the principal, vice principal- academics, students, and colleagues regarding students' progress, behavior, and academic achievements..
	


Classroom Management:


	Establish and enforce a positive and structured classroom environment conducive to learning.
	Implement effective classroom management strategies to address behavioral issues and maintain a respectful atmosphere.


Continuous Improvement:


	Reflect on teaching practices, seek feedback, and actively participate in self-evaluation to enhance professional growth.
	Contribute to school-wide initiatives and collaborate with peers to continuously improve the overall educational experience for students.
	Any other additional responsibility as may be assigned by the primary head and management.


Requirement


	Must have completed NYSC

3.) Floating Teacher (Primary)

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Floating teachers, also known as itinerant or substitute teachers, are versatile educators who adapt to various classrooms and subjects as needed.
	They provide support in the absence of regular teachers, offer additional assistance, and contribute to the overall educational continuity within the school.


Responsibilities
Classroom Coverage:


	Fill in for absent teachers, ensuring that daily lesson plans are followed and educational objectives are met.
	Adapt quickly to different grade levels, subjects, and teaching styles within the school.


Subject-Specific Support:


	Provide targeted support for specific subjects or assist students who need additional help.
	Collaborate with classroom teachers to maintain consistency in curriculum delivery.


Small Group Instruction:


	Work with small groups of students to reinforce concepts, provide enrichment, or address specific learning needs.
	Modify instructional approaches to accommodate diverse learning styles.


Flexible Instructional Roles:


	Assume various instructional roles, including leading whole-class instruction, facilitating group activities, or providing one-on-one support.
	Contribute to a positive and supportive classroom atmosphere.


Classroom Management:


	Implement effective classroom management strategies to maintain a positive and structured learning environment.
	Establish rapport with students while upholding school policies and procedures.


Collaboration with Teachers:


	Communicate with regular classroom teachers to understand specific instructional goals and expectations.
	Collaborate with teaching teams to ensure smooth transitions for students when moving between classrooms.


Professional Development:


	Participate in professional development opportunities to stay current on educational trends and teaching methodologies.
	Continuously improve teaching skills and adapt to evolving educational practices.


Student Assessment and Feedback:


	Assess and evaluate student progress during temporary assignments.
	Provide feedback to regular classroom teachers regarding student performance and any observed challenges or achievements.


Flexibility and Adaptability:


	Demonstrate flexibility in adjusting to varying classroom dynamics, teaching materials, and student populations and campuses.
	Quickly adapt to changes in schedule or unexpected teaching assignments.
